CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
DETAILS: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event sequences.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
DETAILS: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
DETAILS: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Anchor Standards: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
DETAILS: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: (RL.K.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: (RL.1.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 1
DETAILS: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: (RL.2.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 2
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and poetry, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Explain how specific aspects of a text's illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: (RL.3.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 3
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2-3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: (RL.4.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 4
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Describe how a narrator's or speaker's point of view influences how events are described.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: (RL.5.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 5
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Describe how a particular story's or drama's plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they `see` and `hear` when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: (RL.6.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 6
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze how a drama's or poem's form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: (RL.7.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 7
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: (RL.8.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 8
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze in detail its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a text, interact with other characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language evokes a sense of time and place; how it sets a formal or informal tone).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create such effects as mystery, tension, or surprise.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two different artistic mediums, including what is emphasized or absent in each treatment (e.g., Auden's `Musée des Beaux Arts` and Breughel's Landscape with the Fall of Icarus).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: (RL.9-10.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: By the end of grade 9, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 9-10 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 10, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze the impact of the author's choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning as well as its aesthetic impact.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze a case in which grasping a point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: (RL.11-12.8 not applicable to literature)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Literature: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: By the end of grade 11, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

DETAILS: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 1
DETAILS: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph text as well as the focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 2
DETAILS: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 3
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2-3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 4
DETAILS: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 5
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 6
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium's portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 7
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 8
DETAILS: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze how the author unfolds an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between them.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze in detail how an author's ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text (e.g., a section or chapter).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze various accounts of a subject told in different mediums (e.g., a person's life story in both print and multimedia), determining which details are emphasized in each account.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance  (e.g., Washington's Farewell Address, the Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt's Four Freedoms speech, King's `Letter from Birmingham Jail`), including how they address related themes and concepts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: By the end of grade 9, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 9-10 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 10, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine two or more central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to provide a complex analysis; provide an objective summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, including whether the structure makes points clear, convincing, and engaging.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly effective, analyzing how style and content contribute to the power, persuasiveness or beauty of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning (e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze seventeenth-, eighteenth-, and nineteenth-century foundational U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (including The Declaration of Independence, the Preamble to the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and Lincoln's Second Inaugural Address) for their themes, purposes, and rhetorical features.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Informational Text: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: By the end of grade 11, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Recognize and produce rhyming words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.1 (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Kindergarten
DETAILS: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Decode regularly spelled one-syllable words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Read words with inflectional endings.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 1
DETAILS: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 2
DETAILS: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 2
DETAILS: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Reading: Foundational Skills: Grade 2
DETAILS: Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.
