CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Evaluate authors' differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors' claims, reasoning, and evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: History/Social Studies: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6-8 texts and topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to the precise details of explanations or descriptions.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; trace the text's explanation or depiction of a complex process, phenomenon, or concept; provide an accurate summary of the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Follow precisely a complex multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks, attending to special cases or exceptions defined in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 9-10 texts and topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze the structure of the relationships among concepts in a text, including relationships among key terms (e.g., force, friction, reaction force, energy).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, defining the question the author seeks to address.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Translate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text into visual form (e.g., a table or chart) and translate information expressed visually or mathematically (e.g., in an equation) into words.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Assess the extent to which the reasoning and evidence in a text support the author's claim or a recommendation for solving a scientific or technical problem.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Compare and contrast findings presented in a text to those from other sources (including their own experiments), noting when the findings support or contradict previous explanations or accounts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: By the end of grade 10, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler but still accurate terms.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Follow precisely a complex multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks; analyze the specific results based on explanations in the text.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11-12 texts and topics.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Synthesize information from a range of sources (e.g., texts, experiments, simulations) into a coherent understanding of a process, phenomenon, or concept, resolving conflicting information when possible.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Science and Technical Subjects: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Establish and maintain a formal style.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories as appropriate to achieving purpose; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: (See note; not applicable as a separate requirement)

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 6-8
DETAILS: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form and in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level and concerns.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Introduce a topic and organize ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Use varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic and convey a style appropriate to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: (See note; not applicable as a separate requirement)

DETAILS: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 9-10
DETAILS: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/experiments, or technical processes.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Introduce a topic and organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Use varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; convey a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers.

CATEGORY: English Language Arts Standards: Writing: Grade 11-12
DETAILS: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).
